snippet: In 2009, a Milan judge convicted the former C.I.A. station chief, Robert Seldon Lady, and 22 other American intelligence officials in absentia of kidnapping a Muslim cleric.
abstract: Robert Seldon Lady, former Central Intelligence Agency station chief who was convicted in Italy for his role in 2003 abduction of Egyptian-born Muslim cleric Hassan Mustafa Osama Nasr, is  arrested in Panama; Nasr was emblematic in debate over American intelligence practice of extraordinary rendition.

byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio contributed reporting from Rome, and Karla Zabludovsky from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: In 2009, a Milan judge convicted the former C.I.A. station chief, Robert Seldon Lady, and 22 other American intelligence officials in absentia of kidnapping a Muslim cleric.

headline.main: Ex-Employee of C.I.A. Held in Abduction
headline.print_headline: Ex-Employee Of C.I.A. Held In Abduction
